result.execSummary:
The defendant William Neal Ledford was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery by Prisoners [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.20(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: to any other sentence previously imposed

superMiscConds.notes: The DOC shall deduct fine and other court ordered financial obligations from the Defendant's prison income.

guilty form signed(not guilty form unsigned)

Recalled 11:45 am.  Kurt F. Klomberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Annamarie Wineke appears with defendant William Ledford in custody.  Court finds victim rights compliance.  Atty. Klomberg is heard on argument.  Atty. Wineke heard.  Mr. Ledford heard.  Court is heard and sentence imposed:

$4000 Fine to be collected by DOC through all prisoner accounts.
2 years DOC consecutive to any other sentence previously imposed:
1 year IC,
1 year ES.

Day 2. Defendant William Neal Ledford in court, in custody with attorney Annamarie Amy Wineke.  Kurt Frederich Klomberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin, with court officer Kevin Day.  Atty. Klomberg states standard instructions are sufficient.  Atty. Wineke requests self defense instruction, heard on argument.  Atty. Klomberg argues.  Court is heard, denies request for self defense instruction.  Court heard on jury nullification.  Atty. Klomberg is heard.  Discussion regarding case law.  Atty. Wineke heard.  9:04 Recess to review case.  9:10 am, back on the record, Court heard on case.  Atty. Klomberg heard.  Court heard on arguments.  Recess 9:18 am.  Recalled 9:39 am.  Discussion regarding exhibits, parties agree will not send any exhibits in unless requested and then decide if requested exhibits go on case by case basis.  Jury brought in 9:45 am.  Court reads instructions to jury.  Atty. Klomberg closing argument 9:57 am.  Atty. Wineke closing 10:10 am.  Atty. Klomberg rebuttal 10:15 am.  Court final instruction, 10:20 am.  Alternate juror removed.  Jury taken out to deliberate 10:26 am.  Discussion regarding request from transport team regarding restraints.  Court will keep restraints as they are until jury is excused.  Recess 10:31 am.  Recalled 11:10 am, appearances are the same.  Defendant had brought concern that two witnesses were not sworn, Court reporter checks transcript, Court represents that they were both sworn.  Jury brought in at 11:13 am.  Court receives verdict, reads verdict - jury finds defendant guilty.  Court polls the jury.  Court accepts the verdict.  Jury excused 11:19 am, recess at 11:19, will recall at 11:45 am.

839 am.  Case called.  Defendant William Neal Ledford in court, in custody with attorney Annamarie Amy Wineke.  Kurt Frederich Klomberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court summarizes off record discussions regarding security, defendant will not be moved in presence of the jury.  Defendant will be in civilian clothes without hand restraints with leg shakles.  Court addresses Amended Motion in Limine filed by Attorney Wineke on 4/3/17.  #1  - Other Acts, Attorney Klomberg heard, everything has been provided during discovery;  #2 - Statements made by defendant, Attorney Klomberg heard.  Attorney Wineke satisfied.  #4 - Witnesses be sequestered - no objection by Attorney Klomberg with exception of Detective Day, would like to remain as court officer.  Court approves, all witnesses are sequestered.  #5 - State witnesses with criminal convictions, Attorney Klomberg states none of his witnesses have a criminal conviction.  #6 - Prior Acts of Sharada Bowie, Attorney Wineke states this has already been addressed.   Court addresses State's Motion in Limine.  Discussion held on #1 - Defendant's prior convictions.  Attorney Wineke does not feel the earlier convictions are relevant to this case.  Attorney Klomberg responds.  Attorney Wineke indicates Case 98CF144 was reversed by the Court of Appeals.  Attorney Klomberg agrees, this conviction should be stricken, defendant has 7 prior convictions not 8.  Remainder of motion is not an issue/already resolved.  9:13 am court takes recess.  9:27 am Court goes back on the record.  Same appearances.  9:29 am Jury brought in.  Court addresses jury.  Jurors sworn as to qualifications.  Court commences voir dire.  10:16 am counsel conduct their strikes.  10:28 am jury selected, remaining jurors excused.  Oath administered to selected jurors as to issues.  Court gives opening instructions to jurors.  10:39 am jury taken out.  Court takes recess.  Court reconvenes.  Appearances are the same.  10:55 am jurors enter courtroom.  Court gives preliminary instructions to jury.  Attorney Klomberg gives opening statement.  Attorney Wineke gives opening statement.  State calls Corene Gibel, S/T.  Witness identifies defendant.  Cross examination by Attorney Wineke.  Redirect by Attorney Klomberg.  Witness excused.  Sharada Bowie called, S/T.  Witness identifies defendant.  State plays video.  Cross examination by Attorney Wineke.   12:05 pm jury excused for lunch.  Court makes record of side bar conferences.  Attorney Klomberg objecting to Attorney Wineke's misrepenstation of statements made by witness.  Court will provide ruling when reconvenes.  Recalled at 1:20 pm.  Appearances remain the same.  Attorney Klomberg is not pursuing objection.  1:22 pm jurors enter the courtroom.  Sharada Bowie retakes the stand and continues testifying on cross examination.  Redirect by Attorney Klomberg.  Witness steps down.  Phelan Voss called, S/T.  Witness identifies defendant.  Cross examination by Attorney Wineke.  Redirect by Attorney Klomberg.  Witness excused.  State rests, may call Officer Bowie on rebuttal.  2:14 pm jury taken out.  Attorney Wineke moves to dismiss.  Court finds there is enough evidence to support the elements.  Motion is denied.  Court takes recess.  2:38 pm Court reconvenes.  Appearances are the same.  Attorney Wineke indicates defendant will be testifying.  Attorney Wineke releases her witnesses with exception of Officer Bowie, she is to remain, may be called on rebuttal.  Court questions defendant on right to tesify, defendant states would like to testify.  Defendant takes stand and sworn in outside presence of jury.  2:46 pm jurors enter the courtroom.  Attorney Wineke questions witness.  Cross examination by Attorney Klomberg.  Redirect.   Recross.  Attorney Wineke has no other witnesses.  Court takes recess.  3:40 pm jurors exit the courtroom.  Witness steps down.  3:54 pm court reconvenes.  Appearances remain the same.  3:56 pm jurors enter the courtroom.  Defense rests.  Attorney Klomberg recalls Sharada Bowie on rebuttal.  Court admonishes still under oath.  Cross examination.  Witness excused.  State rests its rebuttal.  Testimony closed.  Jurors excused at 4:03 pm until 9:30 am tomorrow morning.  Discussion on proposed jury instructions, Attorney Klomberg states the Self Defense Instruction will be an issue.  Counsel provided with copies of instructions and verdicts.

Defendant William Neal Ledford not in court. Prosecuting Atty Kurt Frederich Klomberg appeared for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Annamarie Amy Wineke in court for Defendant William Neal Ledford. Defendant William Neal Ledford in custody via phone from WCI with attorney Bradley J Jansen in courtroom.  Kurt Frederich Klomberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. This is Atty. Jansen's motion to withdraw on Def.'s request that he be appointed new counsel; Def. heard; State heard - if Def. has new attorney appointed by SPD, does not want trial date continued once again; Def. heard; Court will grant motion to withdraw and refers back to SPD, JT removed; TSC set 11/1/16 at 8:15am; Court will consider Def. has waived counsel if this happens again
Document: Proposed Order - Proposed order for withdrawal Filed by: Bradley J Jansen Reason: heaing is set for sept 30
Motion hearing on September 30, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Jury trial on November 1, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial on November 1, 2016 at 08:30 am.
mtn for con't of mtn hrg & jt sent to judge for review
granting motion to withdraw as counsel

Defendant William Neal Ledford in court with attorney David Andrew Bolles.  Kurt Frederich Klomberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court heard, Atty Bolles filed a motion to withdraw. Def heard, does not object. Court notes correspondence has been received from def. Atty Klomberg does not take position. Court heard, Atty Bolles to withdraw, and will schedule TSC.Reces 1:07pm. Recalled 1:08pm, Same appearances.  Def heard, would like to substitue Judge. Court heard, request is noted. Recess 1:09pm. Recalled. 1:11pm. Same Appearances. Court heard, TSC is scheduled. Atty Bolles to submit order. 
  Telephone scheduling conference scheduled for August 28, 2015 at 08:15 am.

(1:17) Defendant William Neal Ledford in custody via video from WCI with attorney David Andrew Bolles in courtroom.  Gilbert Grant Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges, penalties and right to Preliminary Hearing. Court finds probable cause. Prelim requested waiving time limits. Prelim set 5/14/15 at 10:00am in Br. 3; Court sets $1,000 PA Bond with conditions:  Defendant shall not have any violent or abusive contact with anyone.
